subject: Learning
title: IQ: Overrated Predictor?
description: A 60-second lesson on IQ: Overrated Predictor?.

hook.text: A high IQ predicts school grades. But does it predict life success? Less than you'd think.

buildup.text: IQ measures a narrow band of cognitive abilities: pattern recognition, working memory, processing speed.

discovery.text: Beyond a threshold of about 120, additional IQ points add diminishing returns to real-world achievement.

twist.text: Self-discipline, grit, and social skills predict life outcomes better than IQ above that threshold.

climax.text: Terman's gifted study found high-IQ children didn't uniformly succeed. Persistence mattered more.

punchline.text: IQ gets you in the race. Character determines the finish.

quiz.question: What predicts life success better than IQ above a threshold?
